text: Kurt Hipper (8 November 1932 – 10 February 2009) was a West German rower who represented the United Team of Germany. He competed at the 1956 Summer Olympics in Melbourne with the men's double sculls where they came fourth. He later emigrated to South Africa and was the country's representative of the International Rowing Federation (FISA). ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2009 deaths Category:West German male rowers Category:Olympic rowers of the United Team of Germany Category:Rowers at the 1956 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Zürich Category:European Rowing Championships medalists
title: Kurt Hipper
